content.description: This route is on the right side of the lower wall. Climb a face to a ledge to clip the first (hidden) bolt. Face climb past three more bolts to a vertical crack below a roof. Climb the left most crack above the roof to the anchors up and left. Shares anchors with After Nine.
content.protection: 4 bolts plus some gear. Nuts/perhaps a 0.75 to 2 inch cams.
content.location: Towards the right of the lower wall.

content.description: Immediately right of After Eight. Climb the face past a bolt to a ledge. Climb the face past two bolts to the roof crack. Note: poor rock quality on the rock immediately below the roof. Pull the roof (through the obvious crack) using a stopper, moving up and right to the anchors. Significantly easier if you avoid the roof crack to the right.
content.protection: Trad with 3 bolts. Nuts/double rack to 0.5 inches. Roof protects well with medium stopper.

content.description: Located on the left side of this lower face, climb the face to a ledge. Climb face past one bolt to a short, discontinuous vertical crack system and then move left into another vertical crack past one more bolt to a wide crack than intercepts a large horizontal near the top. Climb the wide crack to the anchors up and left. Small cams for the lower section and a couple larger one for up higher on the climb.
content.protection: Mostly small to medium cams, but with 2 bolts.
content.location: Far left of the lower wall.

content.description: The east facing wall that is directly below Alien Wall and is a detached feature from the main face of Glade and Alien Walls.
